verses.name: Proverbs 20:23
verses.text: Divers weights are an abomination unto the Lord; and a false balance is not good.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:24
verses.text: Man’s goings are of the Lord; how can a man then understand his own way?

verses.name: Proverbs 20:25
verses.text: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:26
verses.text: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:27
verses.text: The spirit of man is the candle of the Lord, searching all the inward parts of the belly.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:28
verses.text: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.
